intro: Telis rhytidiocarpa, commonly known as the red-stemmed flax, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate and lance-shaped, often covered with fine hairs. Telis rhytidiocarpa is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
